parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Fuel Line Failure (Crimped Fittings and Rubber Hoses)
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the fuel line can cause fuel leakage, which can lead to a fire hazard, especially when the fuel drips onto the distributor or exhaust manifold. This can result in a vehicle fire, potentially causing damage, injury, or even death.
symptoms: Fuel smell inside or outside the vehicle
fuel leakage from the fuel line fittings
fuel dripping onto the distributor or exhaust manifold
white smoke coming from the hood area
and the vehicle catching fire.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Recall Issues (Lack of Notification, Unavailability of Parts, and Inadequate Repair)
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of Volkswagen to notify owners of the recall, provide adequate repair, and make parts available can lead to continued fuel line failures, potentially causing accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: Owners not receiving notification of the recall
dealerships refusing to perform the recall repair
parts not being available
and inadequate repair leading to continued fuel line failures.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the engine mount can cause the engine to become loose and fall to the ground, leading to a loss of control and potential accidents.
symptoms: The engine becomes completely loose and falls to the ground
the engine pan falls onto the street and drags on the ground
an engine bracket needs to be replaced.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the electrical system can cause various components to malfunction, leading to safety risks and inconvenience.
symptoms: The horns stop working
the gas and temperature gauges stop working
the air conditioning stops working
the headlights fill with water
the rear heater fan clanks loudly
excessive noise in the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the fuel system can cause fuel leaks, fires, and engine damage, leading to safety risks and costly repairs.
symptoms: Strong smell of raw fuel in the passenger compartment and outside the vehicle
thick black smoke pouring from under the hood
fire in the engine
strong odor of gasoline.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the cooling system can cause engine overheating, damage, and failure, leading to safety risks and costly repairs.
symptoms: The engine temperature gauge goes into the red zone
the vehicle starts smoking
fumes come from the vehicle
loss of coolant
inability to drive the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Engine fires can cause damage to the vehicle, injury, and even death.
symptoms: Engine fire
strong odor of gasoline.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the power steering system can cause the steering wheel to fail, leading to loss of control, accidents, and potential injuries.
symptoms: The steering wheel feels loose or wobbly
the steering wheel fails to respond
the vehicle is difficult to steer
the steering column makes a clicking noise
the rubber on the tires wears off prematurely.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The delay in resolving recall issues can lead to continued safety risks and potential accidents.
symptoms: The dealer is unable to provide the necessary parts to resolve the recall issue
the recall issue is not properly addressed.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The malfunction of the anti-theft alarm can cause unnecessary stress and inconvenience to the vehicle owner.
symptoms: The anti-theft alarm comes on unexpectedly
the alarm is triggered without a valid reason.
